website_summaries.verdict: A well-made, no-frills model by a top brand that's designed to deliver a pleasurable ride.
pros: Boasts a classic design with a banana seat
Assembly is straightforward and can be done quickly
Suitable for men, women, and teens, and works well for smaller individuals
cons: Not very speedy, but this isn't usually a concern when cruising the shore

customer_reviews.title: My dream bike
customer_reviews.text: The bike was way better than I expected. Easy to assemble. My dream bike when I was a kid. It’s mine now never too late to get what you should have gotten. Later it’s my grandkids what a grab.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Villalon

customer_reviews.title: It’s a Schwann love it
customer_reviews.text: What can I say it’s a Schwann stingray always wanted one finally got it love it. I’m 6’ and have no issues riding this bike.
customer_reviews.author: mike franco

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful on the box, but disappointing in the end ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son for his eighth birthday. Was excited to put it together for him. It feels pretty bad to nearly finish only to have one of the cheap .5 bolts that hold the sissy bar up SNAP at the head. Ridiculous that a bike that cost this much uses such terrible hardware. Will not buy from Schwinn again, or rather Pacific Cycles. If you want a Stingray buy an original, it’s what I plan to do. Those were built in Chicago and built to LAST. Lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Clingan

customer_reviews.title: 2019 schwinn stingray blue
customer_reviews.text: The bike came double packaged so the box doesn't get damaged. Very well packed and very nice quality. The alloy wheels won't rust and the blue is almost a candy color. Future collectible.
customer_reviews.author: David Swanson

customer_reviews.title: Be prepared for inferior paint and shipping damage
customer_reviews.text: 2nd one I’ve received now, this one as a replacement, and the paint is scraped and coming off on this one too in the same spots right out of the box. Called schwinn numerous times also and emailed... not one response Now I gotta send the replacement back and deal with the first damaged bike The Last photo is of the scraped forks on the first bike sent ... damage in same spot in both
customer_reviews.author: Richard A.

customer_reviews.title: Genuine Schwinn
customer_reviews.text: It’s pricey but worth it. It is made in China but better quality than the original. The gooseneck is aluminum. The rims are aluminum. The sissy bar actually has clamps to the frame unlike knockoff. The crank is solid and really good threading throughout the bike. I normally buy box store bicycles for my kids like Huffy. This Schwinn is much better quality. Definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Not a true replica but fun, sturdy bike
customer_reviews.text: Ok this is not at all a faithful reproduction of the 70’s bikes. No Ashtabula fork or handlebar stem. Frame does not have the filet brazed look of the original Schwab. Pedals are not the soft rubber. However, unless you are a 60 yo man Wanting your old bike, I think the riding and owning experience will be just fine and match that of yesteryear. Preassembly is substantial so you can quickly “assemble” but the bearings are not adjusted. If you want it smooth, adjust the locknuts and cones. Wheel quality is better than your average department store bike.
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: Arrived damaged
customer_reviews.text: I really want to give this bike 5 stars....it was delivered when promised, easy to assemble and my son LOVES it. The problem is that it arrived damaged...the paint on the front fork is scraped and chipped, revealing the metal underneath. The damage wasn’t noticeable until it was completely removed from all packaging so it was obviously packaged this way by the manufacturer. For the cost of the bike, Schwinn should have much better quality control. Very disappointed that we will now have to put out more money to have it repaired so that the paint doesn’t chip any further.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Coolest bike on the block
customer_reviews.text: So, obviously, this bike is super cool. I wanted a basic bike for my 11 year old to cruise around on without all the bells and whistles. This really is great because it is a nice size allowing for a wide variety of ages. My 9 year, though he looks small on it, is able to ride it. I can ride it too. There aren’t many bikes that actually work for all age ranges. Is it worth 350 bucks - definitely not. Am I glad I bought in anyway- yep!
customer_reviews.author: D D

customer_reviews.title: Nice bike design...poor paint process!
customer_reviews.text: The saddle arrived with some scratches. I want to get a new saddle. Second bike arrived with several scratches on the frame! The paint does not have a prime process! Really very disappointed with the quality of the paint is very cheap! It is a nice bike in its design, kids learn very quick to ride the bike.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar N.

customer_reviews.title: NOT HAPPY
customer_reviews.text: NEED MORE THAN WHAT IT COMES WITH TO HOLD THE SEAT BARS IN PLACE CAN'T TIGHTEN THE SCREWS TIGHT ENOUGHT TO KEEP IT FROM SLIDING SCREW HEAD BROKE OFF ONE AND IS NOW STUCK.NOT HAPPY
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I won’t be buying anything this expensive from you again.
customer_reviews.text: This is a $400 bike and it came with chipped paint all over as you can see in the pictures above. If I had wanted a used bike I would have gone to a garage sale. I’m surprised at amazon for not having better quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Kathi

customer_reviews.title: Stay away!!!
customer_reviews.text: Mine was not assembled correctly, the few bits that did come assembled anyways. I ended up paying $225 for a bicycle shop to reassemble everything. See my picture for how horribly the steering tube assembly came, it’s bent to heck and dangerous!
customer_reviews.author: Ren

customer_reviews.title: Like new-misnomer
customer_reviews.text: I bought the bike with as a return item described by amazon as minor paint cosmetic issues on the frame. Unfortunately it was not accurately described enough because when I received it , it the frame paint was not minor, it was major the chain guard was dented and the paint on it was scratched, the chrome fender on the rear was dented. It was as if someone else received it and carelessly threw it back in the box. It had too many missing parts ie..dented nuts and bolts , it was also missing a foot pedal. QC was not an issue!!
customer_reviews.author: Kim Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Great Sturdy Retro Bike!!
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Love it. Love it! Great Sturdy Retro Schwinn takes me back to my childhood in the seventies! I'm 57 years young and 5'3 and it fits me just fine!!!
customer_reviews.author: Clare B. McSwain

customer_reviews.title: Wrong handlebars sent
customer_reviews.text: Handlebars do not fit into the neck/fork assembly. I either need consultation so I can swap these bars for one that fits this kids schwinn sting-ray (not adult schwinn sting-ray). Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It’s cool....
customer_reviews.text: I gave a 4 star due to the sissy bar sliding up and down after tightening all the way. Had to take it to a bike repair shop the same day I got it. Other than that it’s cool. Wish it was made in America.
customer_reviews.author: Johanna Russell

customer_reviews.title: Very nice bike
customer_reviews.text: I purchased for my grandson for Christmas during one of the big sales. Very nice bike!!! It is like the bikes when I was a kid but nicer. The tires are wider It’s just a very sturdy bike. My grandson is 9 and he loved it.
customer_reviews.author: dana hubbard

customer_reviews.title: One cool ride!
customer_reviews.text: My 9 year old son absolutely loves this bike! He gets lots of compliments when he's riding around the neighborhood. The blue paint looks great. The bike is not on the light side, but if feels very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: dean

customer_reviews.title: i had the same one as a kid
customer_reviews.text: thanks for bring them back i love these bikes i brought an old one on ebay years ago for one of my son's he didn't seem to get it ! the sixties was a different time i would love to go back .
customer_reviews.author: BRUCE ROZAK

customer_reviews.title: Wrong instructions
customer_reviews.text: Came with the wrong assembly instructions. Totally different bike. Had to call a friend who knew how to assemble bikes to help me.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: awesome bike!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bike and i loved it it rides well and is vary durable i road it a lot for the 1st few weeks but now i ride it a little less but still a great bike
customer_reviews.author: Hilary

customer_reviews.title: Price well Exceeds Quality was hoping for better.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with this bike was hoping for a $400.00 product I paid for ,, instead I got a $100.00 Reproduction . Very cheaply made the first ride the reflectors fell out of the peddles . A lot of corners were cut in the quality of this bike . Could have went to Walmart and bought twice the bike for half the price ... not happy at all !!
customer_reviews.author: K S R

customer_reviews.title: Great Bike so Far!
customer_reviews.text: Save the money and assemble yourself. Easy to put together. Great bike. A little pricey. Made our daughter happy and she loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Ali

customer_reviews.title: Great bike now and great bike then
customer_reviews.text: Grandson loves it. Just like Dad first bike but without fenders
customer_reviews.author: Curtis A. Stephan

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time, money and effort.
customer_reviews.text: Box was received OPEN already. The metal was already scuffed up. The handlebars were inverted upside down, so entirely useless. Missing pieces and the wrong instructions were included in the box. Was suppose to treat myself to a bike so I could save money going to work, but I should have just bought a walmart huffy for the quality I received.
customer_reviews.author: Autumn

customer_reviews.title: Great bike!
customer_reviews.text: Brings back memories same bike my fiancé rode as a teenager awesome bike!
customer_reviews.author: M. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Damaged paint
customer_reviews.text: The paint on the front fork is chipped in several places. Unclear what recourse we have other than replacing the bike entirely. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Claire Callahan

customer_reviews.title: Smooth and Stylish!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 14 year old son. This is definitely a “cruisin’ through the park” bike. He assembled it himself. Taking it on some trails already. We love it.
customer_reviews.author: Martina

customer_reviews.title: Nice bike but not really worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Well packaged. Everything went great including assembly until it came time to tighten the seat bolts . One of the nuts was missing . I turned the box inside out to find it but no luck. I had a bolt and nut assortment in my garage and was able find one that fit.
customer_reviews.author: BR-549

customer_reviews.title: Shipping issues.
customer_reviews.text: This bike was all scraped up.(I have pics) I didnt wanna return it because of the lengthy time to get another one. So I'm just dealing with it..thank you
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Sick nasty bike bro!
customer_reviews.text: The little clips for the bar on the seat were the only problem I noticed. The crome chipped off and I had to paint them. Everything else was pretty decent. I'm almost 6 foot and can ride it fine.
customer_reviews.author: Dawson S.

customer_reviews.title: Cool looking bike
customer_reviews.text: Reduced it by one star because the tire tube had a hole in it. We had to go to the local store to buy a replacement tube in order for my son to ride his bike. Bike seat is uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Lan C.

customer_reviews.title: Rad little bike, don’t know if it’s quite worth the $$$
customer_reviews.text: Unboxed and set up today. Love the remake. BMX classic. Bike arrived with puncture in seat and missing bolts for sissy bar... not happy about that. We will see how it rides!
customer_reviews.author: Britney

customer_reviews.title: Great old school bike.  Quality!
customer_reviews.text: Great old school bike for my 7 year old grandson! Really sturdy!
customer_reviews.author: John Williams

customer_reviews.title: Just as described
customer_reviews.text: Bike was for grandchild he loved it a hit in the neighborhood
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy with our purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Birthday present for an 8-year-old. Looks amazing and is very sturdy. We couldn’t be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Alexieff

customer_reviews.title: This came in damaged with two left petals and had to be returned.Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This came in damaged with two left petals and had to be returned.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected, Very nice !
customer_reviews.text: Very nice old school bike. Brings me back to my youth in the early 1960's. I always wanted a Schwinn Sting-Ray. The bike even has the original racing slik rear tire. Just a note, you will need metric tools to put assembly the bike. Very easy assembly!
customer_reviews.author: Linda HD

product_meta.title: Schwinn Sting-Ray Cruiser Bike, 20-Inch Wheels, Red
feature_bullets: Features the iconic Schwinn Sting-Ray steel frame and rigid fork.
Schwinn period-correct parts give the bike a vintage look and feel.
Single speed drive train is simple to use; intuitive rear coaster brake provides sure stops.
Includes the classic Sting-Ray banana seat and high-rise ape handlebar with grips.
20-inch wheels fit riders age 6+, or 4’0” to 5’0”. This bike comes ready to be assembled and includes a limited lifetime for as long as you own the bike.
